Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel on a quieter Island”
Reviews.Author: Steffi R
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Biasutti Hotel for 3 nights and we were really surprised how nice it was. We booked the Hotel with booking.com and payed just 200â‚¬ for 3 nights, althought it was a special offer. The Hotel staff was unbelivebly nice (i worked in a Hotel once and i know how it is, but these guys were very friendly). The breakfast was good as well and you had enough choices. Our room was very big with a nice double bed. The furniture was quite old but i guess that is the specific venice charm - we liked it. The TV was huge (with English BBC News) and the WIFI was free, even in the rooms. The Hotel is in a very nice area on Lido. The mini shopping street, a few restaurants and the busboat stop are very close. If you dont mind to get a boat every morning to Venice and like it a bit quieter at night its the perferct place to go. It just takes you 15min to the Marcus Square and the boat tickets are surprisingly cheap. When you are under 30 you can buy one of these 'rolling cards' which allow you to get cheaper offers in museums and on the boat tickets. (Overall we paid togehter 44â‚¬ for a 72h boat ticket) But if you are over 30 it doesnt really matter either, because these tickets are not expensive (33â‚¬ each) and very usefull to get to certain places in Venice. We were surprised how big it actually was. We both imagined a much smaller city. If you like walking aroung in Venice dont forget to buy a map (you can get them for 2â‚¬), especially when you have a target. We tried it without one and ended up somewhere random. The streets are quite often dead ends and there a lot of water around so you need to find a bridge to cross it.

Reviews.Title: “A well located hotel in a very pretty area.”
Reviews.Author: Emma D
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel in April 2012 whilst we explored the various things that Venice had to offer. Overall it was a very pleasant hotel with all of the basics that you could possibly need. It's location on the island of Lido is perfect for getting away from the hussle and bussle of Venice itself. If you're under 29 years of age I would highly recommend buying a Rolling Venice card for 4 Euros which entitles you to a large discount on boat transport passes. We paid 18euros for unlimited boat travel for 72 hours instead of 32euros. The pass also gives you lots of discounts on main attractions and specific restaurants. The hotel is approximately a 1 hour boat ride from Marco Polo airport and costs around 26euros for a return trip. Beware when waiting for the Alilaguna boat back to the airport - local Italians seem to be given priority even if they haven't waited for the boat as long as you! Only dissapointments with the hotel: walls were extremely thin and we could hear every word of our neighbouring guests, beds were very hard, shower had no curtain so baths are probably a wiser decision and the decor was a little old.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, a little dated, but good location and staff”
Reviews.Author: JonB-CA
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 2 wonderful nights - it is a 5 minute walk to the ferry over to Venice, but Lido itself is wonderful and quiet at night, and has its own little shopping area nearby with amazing gelato and good restaurants. The front porch is a great place to relax in the afternoon (see photo!).

Reviews.Title: “Good service and facilities, good price, but not 4*”
Reviews.Author: I-veritas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Best Western Biasutti for a couple of nights before moving on to Eastern Europe. The vaparetto is easily accessible by foot from Marco Polo airport, take the red or blue line (quicker) to Lido SME port. The Biasutti is in a good location not far from here, but it is a question of knowing where you are going â€“ I would recommend investing in a local map rather than a taxi! Thereâ€™s nothing much going on in Lido, but I came to realise it is a great escape from Venice, and the weather was still very temperate in mid-October. The main square and shopping area (just a 3 minute walk if you know where you are going!) is busy in the evening, although the outdoor cafes closed by 10.30pm the gelateria was open until midnight. There is also a Billa supermarket open early to late which is a handy stop off for picnic items. The hotel itself is pretty enough from the outside, but is an old property and this is reflected in the interior. The staff were friendly and very helpful, and the facilities matched expectations so overall I was happy staying here. Access to Venice from Lido is very easy (its better value to buy a travelcard rather than singles), consequently not a lot of time was spent in the hotel itself. The buffet breakfast was more than just standard continental fare â€“ in fact was a coffee and cake-lovers dream, although cooked items were also available, and available until 10.30am so was far from rushed. The buffet was actually better than the Villa Oriana Relais St Agnello (the TA reviews rave about the breakfast but this was in fact superior). There was a small gym available (the swimming pool was closed for the winter), a bar and terrace area. Internet access was available in the public areas, and I was pleased to find that I could also access it from the room itself. The hotel staff were happy to arrange free transportation to the glass factory in Murano, which was a bonus. Now for the negatives: the room itself was a disappointment; dark with poor lighting, styled in shabby Venetian fashion with little space to manoeuvre suitcases etc. The TV was small, old, difficult to navigate with limited channels and very poor reception. The fridge which was very handy, and the bathroom was bright and clean, with a huge jacuzzi bath and powerful shower, both of which I lovedâ€¦what I really disliked though was a lack of a shower curtain, which meant that the bathroom would flood no matter how careful I was. It was not the kind of room you would want to do anything more than sleep in. I donâ€™t understand why this hotel is rated as a 4* - I thought it was on a par with the Hotel Bazzoni, Tremezzo (Lake Como) which was a 3*. I would recommend staying in this hotel for the location away from bustling Venice, price (far more reasonable than Venetian hotels) and service from the staff, they really were nice people. I would not however recommend it for newlyweds, those with mobility problems as there are some steps to the entrance of the hotel, or anyone wanting a luxurious experience.

Reviews.Title: “nice but boring”
Reviews.Author: muzakmanGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We got off to a bad start when we arrived & found out that the company we had booked with (Hotel Connect) had gone bust!! which meant we had to pay all over again! however the manager gave us a good deal and we will claim the money back, the hotel is about 15mins walk to the boat terminals so its quite handy, but nothing happens at this hotel i never seen anyone sit and have a drink and they don't do snacks only breakfast which is the same thing everyday, eating out in venice is very very expensive no matter where you go but the supermarkets are reasonable, we were here for 5 days which was too long 3 would be enough, its a good hotel for getting around and sightseeing but don't stay too long or you will be very bored.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest people and great service - An Oasis in a town of unfriendliness.”
Reviews.Author: Jay201146
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights along with our two very young kids. The room was really nice. It was actually a suite with 3 rooms. The staff was extremely nice and helpful from luggage to cabs and everything in between. This turned out to be our Oasis from the rude and unfriendly Venetians.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: JenD3
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 nights at the hotel and would go back again in a second. We managed to get a great deal on the room through a 3rd party hotel site, and were pleasantly surprised with the size and quality of our "economy room". On confirming the booking the hotel had told us it had a french double bed - this is actually just a standard UK double so perfectly fine. Our room on the 4th floor also had a wardrobe/dressing area, spacious bathroom with shower over the bath, and in-built jacuzzi in the bath! We also made use of the wifi which was free throughout the stay, and good, strong, and quick connection from the 4th floor. The only tiny minor downsides - the mattress on the bed was a little hard, and there was only 1 English tv channel (BBC news) out of about 300 I would expect a few more! Location wise - after a busy day in Venice with people everywhere, it was nice to go back to the peace of the Lido. There are a handful of great restaurants within 5-10 minutes walk, down the main street (Santa Maria Elisabetta). Access-wise it's also very easy. From the airport you can get the Alilaguna boats - the Rossa line is pretty much direct to the Lido and takes about 40 minutes, or the Blue line which goes all around Venice ending up at the Lido (about an hour). Return ticket was 25 euros each. To get into central Venice there are boats leaving from the Lido stop every 5-10 minutes, and going to all different parts of Venice, taking 10 minutes plus depending on which bit you go to. Definitely be sure to have a good boat-line map as there are a lot of them! At the Lido station there are electronic boards to tell you what boats are coming so very easy to figure out. We bought a 48 - hour ticket that can be used on all the ACTV/vaparetto lines - 28 euros each and would definitely recommend it as single trips are about 6 euros each! This is a different company from the airport service. Hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the Lido boat stop. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but there is a patisserie on Santa Maria Elisabetta and greengrocers nearby for fresh fruit as well if you want some. Also took a walk up to the beach - again about 10 minutes from the hotel and great to relax away from the hustle of the mainlands.

Reviews.Title: “very well located,comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: greenbid
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in September and was more than pleased with hotel. Loved its location, so close to all the amenities of the lido. Could come and go with no hassle to Venice, only 10minutes by vaporetta. Hotel was comfortable with a relaxing terrace and we were lucky to have a quiet, large and newly decorated room. Would return.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing hotel away from the throngs in Venice”
Reviews.Author: kbknopp
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this wonderful hotel; Of course we came to tour Venice, and this hotel sits in a quite neiborhood of lovely Venicien style villas on the island of Lido, only a 15 minute vaporetto (boat bus) ride away from St. mark's Square uin the heart of Venice. We had a lovely room onthe second floor looking out to a georgous villa across the street. The buffet breakfast is wonderful; A full aray of breakfast pastries, breads and cakes, cereals, juices, eggs, meats, you name it. We had a special deal, and got the stocked mini bar (fridge) in our room free. The beach is only a 10 minute walk away; the vaporetto terminal with many lines going everywhere in Venice, and the surrounding islands is only a ten minutes walk away. The island of Lido has cars and buses, so a car ferry makes round trhe clock stops there also; but car can't go into Venice, you have to park on Lido , then take a vaporetto line to your destination. The staff is very nice and helpful. They offer many tours too;; We took a free tour of a glass factory on the island of morano; A private boat picks you up and wisks you to Murano, where you get a free tour of the wionderful glass that is famous there. Then you are on your own to discover the island; go to Venice, or wahatever. My advice fora relaxing visit to the Venice area, is to stay here and relax on Lido. It's a nice island in its own right. Yes, during summer the beach is crowded, but we did't come to lounge on the beach but to discover Venice. The main street on Lido has many many restaurant and shops also. Don't forget the gelato!! There is nothing like it anywhere else int he world!!

Reviews.Title: “Tutti frutti”
Reviews.Author: Runjarr
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 10 days during our summerholiday in venice. this was our second trip to venice, this time we wanted to har some beachlife too and the lido was a good choise for this. the hotel is clean, big rooms (superiour) with furniturestyles from 1800. breakfast is really simple, but if u like cakes and a lot of juicevariants it will be perfect. 10 minutes walk to free beach, and 7 minutes to waterbus. a lot of good restaurants around the hotel, try out Toro steakhouse and Villa Laguna :-)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to escape the bustling centre”
Reviews.Author: LifeasMe
Reviews.Content: We found the Lido to be the ideal location to avoid staying the the bustling city centre, but with 24h vaperetto (water bus) service a 10min ride away priced â‚¬6.50 one way or longer passes (12h, 36h, 72h, etc) it was ideal to enjoy both the attractions of Venice and the relaxation of the beach. We made the mistake of jumping in a taxi upon arrival at the port, only to find the hotel was literally just around the corner! It was a 5min walk to either the Vaperetto or the beach. The hotel itself was OK, the rooms were small and a little floral for our tastes, but clean and suited our needs. The maid service was every day. The staff were very accomodating and friendly. The breakfast buffet had an odd selection - a lot of cakes and pizza - arrive early if you wish to get some scrambled egg! But for what we paid it was adequate. You can hire bikes for â‚¬7 for the day and the offer a free boat service to Murano to witness the glass blowing. Cafes and restaurants are a two minute walk away and very relaxing. A water taxi direct to the airport from the Lido takes 45mins @ â‚¬15. This is not luxury accommodation, but for location and cleanliness I would thoroughly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel at the Lido”
Reviews.Author: TallTexWally
Reviews.Content: This is a small, hotel that fits well into the neighborhood of large, fine homes in the Lido, close to Venice. It was easy to walk to the shops and restaurants in the Lido, and the beach was just a few blocks away. The boat to Venice was close by, too. I was on a group tour of Italy, and this hotel was one of the better ones we stayed at. I had stayed at hotels in nearby Mestre on previous tours, and I liked staying on the Lido better. The Lido is a nice, quiet area, close to Venice, but with a relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. My only criticism of the Best Western Biasutti is that the hotel was a bit on the small side, and it would have been more convenient to be closer to the boat dock to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Quait and nice to vaation”
Reviews.Author: rasangi
Reviews.Content: I am from srilanka were vacation in hotel biasutti in lido vanice.rooms are very nice and large.housekeeping was very well.breakfast buffe unbilivable.we hope to go agin this place.thank you. I AM RASANGIKA

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Biasutti, Nice Position, very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: amilanadeera
Reviews.Content: Biasutti is a great quiet place to stay while visiting Venice, Very close to the Vaparetto for easy access to Venice and the lagoon islands. We enjoyed staying on the Lido away from the hustle and bustle and insane crowds on Venice. And for the price, would definitely recommend this hotel. Room was very clean, bed was ultra comfortable, staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and good hospitality. Definitly I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: sanjaya_ronellanka
Reviews.Content: Very nice Place, Peoples are very friendly and helpful. Had very good room service. Restaurant and bar also good place too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but not as well connected as the main Islands of Venice”
Reviews.Author: rahulmisra204
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very good, excellent decorations, looked like a conversion of a very old building. The rooms were small but clean. The only negative is the time one loses in commuting to and from the Lido to travel to San Marco and the airport. The staff was very friendly and helpful, they helped us plan our day in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Position,very helpful staff, excellent”
Reviews.Author: EMM48
Reviews.Content: Best Western Biasutti hotel is in a good position quiet but central for the beach,vaporetta station to travel via all the islands of Venice,staff very helpful and friendly even when hotel heavily booked I'm a travel agent and I was very happy

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel we have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: CALIFORNIA55
Reviews.Content: The air conditioner did not work. We could not sleep in our tiny room on the sunny side of the hotel. The bed was worn out and uncomfortable. Room servicing took up to 6 pm on Sunday. We cannot recommend this overpriced hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid - Musty Smelling Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Hols_addict
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location in the beautiful Lido. It is located only a few minutes walk from both the port & beach in a nice quiet residential part of town. Granted I got the room for quiet a good price however this is still a 4 star hotel and even though I did not expect the best room in the hotel I also did not expect my room to have rotten wooden floor boards or a damp musty smell either. This is obviously an issue other people have experienced as there were about 5 air fresheners under & over the old wardrobe. I only had to stay for 2 nights so did not unpack as there is no way I could have put my clean clothes in either the damp wardrobe or drawers provided. Maybe there are better rooms but if you are going please avoid both room # 319 & room #1. As an aside the Lido is a very beautiful place to stay in the summer months with an amazing beach and would definitely recommend a visit - just choose another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely clean hotel idealy placed on the Lido”
Reviews.Author: Brenda010
Reviews.Content: Lovely clean hotel in a quiet position about 8 minutes from water bus stop. Staff were very friendly and informative. Breakfasts were continental but loads of choice only downside was the coffee (tried lots of options but never got a good cup). Apparantly you can request a Kettle,cups and sachets for the room. Buy a water bus pass for 24,36 or 48 hrs and you can visit all round the canal routes. Very good value as you can "'hop on and off'"all the time especially good if it is wet or cold! Visited the Trattoria Africa round the corner from the hotel after trip Advisor comments. It was excellent we went there twice. We used the hotel before a cruise. Can certainly recommend this hotel and will use it again if I visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “good choise and best money value”
Reviews.Author: hima2000
Reviews.Content: Generally, Venice is incredible place, and Lido the perfect choice to stay, at least I do believe, we had a best four night honeymoon last of April, quite island. Four star hotel but Buffet is at least five star service, mini bar available. Lovely, helpful staff.net access available in lobby get password from front disk get online, slow download but ok,we stay in room 108,web photo same in real Looking for unforgotten honeymoon , just go there.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: pawn4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. It is located in Lido an island about 10 min. away from San Marco by boat. Nice, clean, hotel which is located in a very beautiful part of the island.They gave us one bedroom with a queen bed and then two small bedrooms with sengle beds that my kids loved it. Breakfast was great and the staff were nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not ideal location for a short trip”
Reviews.Author: Busybee087
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this hotel, before continuing on our trip around Italy. On first impression I found the staff at reception a bit abrupt and not too helpful. The location wasnt ideal for our short stay. Breakfast wasnt too bad though. The room was very small, but it did have a balcony which was nice. Overall i don't think I'd recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Gmatti
Reviews.Content: Very good location outside Venice centre. The hotel is 5-7 minutes walk from the Vaparetto stop on The Lido. St Mark's Square is just 10 minutes by aporetto and they run all day long. Our room was small and clean, suprisingly bathroom was huge. Breakfast which was included was good too. Only con is WiFi reception only in the lobby, although free, there are some shops and restaurants and even a supermarket close by. A good place to eat is "La Pizzeria" close to the Vaporetto stop at the start of Viale Santa Maria Elisabetta. We've eaten there several times and service has always been good and friendly, Pizzas are large and good, and there are also good pasta dishes and salads. Overall this hotel did offer good value for money compared to other hotels in central Venice .

Reviews.Title: “clean hotel in a residential street”
Reviews.Author: peak73
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a ten minute walk from the water bus point but it is advisable to get a taxi or horse and carriage if carrying heavy suitcases. It took us a while to find it late at night and after a flight some may prefer (this includes us!)to get there quickly and settle in. The rest of the time it is fine to walk the ten minutes of level pavements to the vaporetto. The room was clean with a view of the avenue outside. The bedding and towels were lovely. The staff were efficient and pleasant. The room could have done with a coat of fresh paint. There was a very small ensuite with jacuzzi bath. This made quite a noise and we were kept awake by the next rooms bath as they prepared to leave at 4 a.m. The furniture was highly decorated and painted but smelt and looked old inside.(-O.K. for a private house choice but not a 4 star hotel.) There was no tea /coffee facilities in the room although I presume room service was available at a cost. Details of where to go / what to see, in the room would have been a nice and useful touch. Avoid the self service coffee machine in the morning , it isnt good. Fresh cafetiers at the table would be much better. The breakfast is contenental, adequate but no cooked breakfast available, which was a disappointment to us. There was no one in the bar in the evening and the lights were off in the gym . There are a few garden tables to sit on outside but the hotel was very lacking in atmosphere and more like a B&B on a residential street.

Reviews.Title: “More 3 thatn 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Pitch24
Reviews.Content: Firstly can i start by saying this hotel is a lovely hotel. The room was large and clean with plenty of space for your clothes. It had extra blankets and pillows and the most comfortable bed ever. I was a little concerned about the toilet however which was right at the side of a window, (although covered with a net), i did feel a little self conscious as you could clearly see through the netting to outside, and did feel that this could be visa versa. The hotel itself is in a quiet residential area, so quiet you could hear a pin drop, but to be fair this was very very pleasant. It is about a 5 min walk from the water bus drop off point, however if just arriving it will probably take you 10, but it is very easy to find. Having jumped off the boat, turn right and head over the small bridge, then take the first left, (hotel is signposted down the street). Continue down the street until you reach the cross roads/canal, continue straight ahead and the hotel is on your left about 100 mtrs from the cross road. The reason for the title is that for me the hotel does not offer the facilities and amenites that a four star hotel would do. The breakfast as already mentioned in other threads is not up to much. There were two cereals to choose from, 3 different types of juice, which was quite good. My husband stated that the coffee was not very good but still drank it. There was no toast or facility to toast any bread. the bread was only bread rolls. There was a small warming plate that contained scrambled eggs, which you had to get as soon as it was put in the heater other wise it would be stone cold. The heater also contained garden peas, cauliflower,and sweetcorn !!!!!!!!!!. There were numerous cakes to pick from and some fresh fruit, but all in all i would say this is not the makings of a 4 star breakfast. There is no coffee/tea making facilites in the rooms either. Staff were pleasant enough and always had a smile on their face. Lido itself at this time of year ( begining of March) is like a ghost town, but we also found this true of Venice. Where does everyone go at night, the place is deserted. Having said that i thought Venice was a very beautiful and romantic city and would reccommed anyone to go. Just be sure to take enough money with you because it is very expensive, even in the reccommeded 'cheap' restaurants. We did find a lovely restaurant not far from the hotel, and came reccommended by trip advisor. I think it is called Andios or something like that.( will post name when i find it out). As you exit the hotel, turn right back up to the cross roads. Once there turn left and head down the street. The restaurant is about 300 mtrs down on the left just after another hotel. ( again when i locate the calling card with full details i will post the address). it is closed mon/tues, but is a very pleasant and welcoming restaurant. it must be good as there are pictures of film stars on the walls that have eaten there during the venice film festival. This hotel is in a good location if you want to be away from the centre of venice, which i can imagine during summer is a nightmare. The transport system is very easy to use and is around 10mins from Lido to venice. I would reccommend the hotel, but think it should be classed as a 3 star and not a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: aitch11
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was excellent, a good size, comfortable and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was mediocre and coffee dire, but we were forewarned! Didn't eat in the hotel in the evening for that reason. Staff were ok, but almost seemed to want to avoid you. The Lido is a good place to stay and a more reasonable place to eat than Venice itself. I recommend the set menus as you know what you will pay. We paid 250 euros for a decent, but not spectacular, meal for 2 well away from St Marks. For wine to drink or take home visit the delightful little wine shop on the Via Negroponte.

Reviews.Title: “Lido a lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: JAFA1
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from Best Western Biasutti stay of 6 nights. Lido is a very quiet and a great option instead of Central Venice, which is very busy and everyone wants your business! Lido has a good selection of restaurants and the best Gelato !. I have also read many reviews and there is such a wide range of opinions about accommodation, its hard to know what its really like. I've decided that if you dont have great expectation, you will not be disappointed. The Biasutti is a clean comfortable establishment for what we paid. We travelled with our 2 year old and everything was fine, our Italian is limited and all the staff were very friendly. The hotel is situated very close to the Main Lido Shops, where there are a number of food stores you can buy a hot chicken (Billa) or ham, cheese and bread, should you not wish to eat at a Restaurant. Biasutti breakfast is fine, not a Full English, but decent enough - my tip is to ask the waiting staff for coffee and tea, they will bring it to your table, we too noticed the older coffee machine. We only had one problem with the Bar Fridge in the room as we bought ham for our lunches, the Bar Fridge temperature was warmer than it should've been, we asked a couple of times about it, staff said it was working, but just not cold enough .. it was never really resolved .. Other than this we were very happy. 10 min boat ride into Hustle and Bustle of St Marco Square. Overall cant complain .. we had a lovely trip. We also hired a bike which catered for our 2 year old (interesting looking thing) and spent 3 hours leisurely biking/stopping round Lido - great way to see the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: gover
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Best Western Biasutti. We would have liked having a shower vs a bathtub and the room was very very small but we liked the neighborhood that the hotel is located in. Nice to take the water bus over to the main island during the day and then return at night to Lido. Breakfast buffet was OK.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Venice Lido Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rich-in-the-sun
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on a quiet street that runs parallel to the main restaurant/bars. Large clean fresh rooms. Typical OK continental breakfast, cold meats, bread etc.. Nearest restaurants, bike hire, bars are a short walk away. Take directions if arriving by water bus, or water taxi at the moment (it will drop you at water bus stop as nearest canal is shut for repair), because finding the hotel initially is not easy. But once your there its a piece of cake. We used the public beach a couple of afternoons, it was free, but not especially clean ( cigarette ends in the sand ). Venice is 20 minutes by water bus, which run 24 hours. We stayed 3 nights post cruise, ideal for a quiet stay and allowed a few day /evening trips to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcinb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was terrible. The room was VERY small for the price, the bathroom was small. The tv was terrible and no channels that were worth watching because all the channels were fuzzy. The restaurant was terrible. You have to make a reservation to eat but no one tells you that. We found out after we sat down just for a desert. They were so mad that we didn't make a reservation that they just let us sit there. Everytime a waiter would walk by they said "we'll be with you in 1 minute."........ 1 hour later we left, stunned that they wouldn't serve us. To make matters worse, there was only 1 other family in there, so it wasn't because they were buisy. You pay high price for this hotel and you get nothing but attitude in return. Would I stay here again? NEVER.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal”
Reviews.Author: dj_burger
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days at the hotel and found it perfect for our needs. It is just 10 minutes walk from either the beach or the vaparetto water taxi, which offers a good combination of busy tourist trip to venice city or chilled family friendly fun on the coast. The staff are really friendly and rooms clean and well decorated. The hotel is situated in a quiet area but close to all the action. We had bed and breakfast. The food was fine, if a little uninventive, but we ate out in town every evening so not a problem I can recommend the Carribe restaurant, 15 minutes walk along the sea front, where the menu was reasonable and food good (even if the service was a little slow). Alternatively, there are a couple of reasonable restaurants in town. Venice is not too expensive if you come from London like ourselves. We bought a picnic for lunch each day and watched the world go by near the rialto bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Fair Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day stay at this hotel which is on the Lido, Venice. A quiet haven away from the tourist mania of Venice (which as another reviewer says is a nice 10 minute ride away on the Vaparetto). The hotel itself is very clean and the staff all speak English and were very pleasant and polite. Breakfast was very good, but they need a new coffee machine!! Trattoria just around the corner called Affrica is a must visit - food great and the price too. The room itself had a balcony (which we didn't expect), but a very tiny bathroom. The bed was extremely firm and the pillows the same. Saying all of this, we would stay there again, the garden was lovely and a very tranquil area.

Reviews.Title: “I'd definitely come back (provided they change their coffee!)”
Reviews.Author: AdamSolo
Reviews.Content: It was my first visit to Venice and we decided to stay in Lido (mainly due to the high prices of hotels in Venice itself) trying to get more for the same money. It was the right decision! Firstly, it only takes about 15 min with the Vaporetto to reach St Mark's square and it's quite a nice trip. Secondly, there are quite a few good restaurants in Lido and the area is less crowded than Venice so it's a good place to have a relaxed dinner after having been the full day going around Venice. Thirdly, the hotel itself is definitely worth what you're paying for. Although rated with four stars (should be 3), the room was spacious and clean and the bathroom was quite big (it even had a noisy spa!). The staff was also very friendly. And last but not least, the only negative point about this hotel is the coffee served for breakfast. Really disgusting!! Try to avoid it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: HarryHarris-Johnson
Reviews.Content: Before we arrived we e-mailed the hotel for directions, we recieved back perfect details which meant we had no problems finding the hotel - the staff were very helpful pre our stay and during it. We were a little worried about staying on Lido, however compared to the prices of the hotels in and around St Marks Square, this hotel was a great bargin. It was only 15 mins by vaporetto so very close but far enough away to get away from the crowds after a day being pushed and shoved. The vaporetto runs early is the morning and late at night so you can stay our late. Our room was a good size with a fab shower and a small balcony - lovely for a beer at the end of the day. The hotel is also very close to a number of bars and restaurants on Lido. I would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “easy base but lousy coffee!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in early March 2006. Hotel easy to find from the vaporetto stop. Easy, level 10 minute walk, fine on foot with wheeled cases or rucksack. Staff were friendly. Liked the bedroom, spacious, clean and with italian furniture. Great bed - huge and really comfortable, appreciated after hours of sightseeing! As previous reports said, plenty of food at breakfast but if you rely on a decent cup of tea or coffee to get you going first thing, this probably isn't the place for you! Both come out of a machine, disappointing. We felt staying on the Lido was great in giving us a wider perspective of Venice and we loved taking the vaporetto across the lagoon in the mornings and seeing the familiar skyline unfold before us across the water as we approached San Marco. And this weekend we had the added bonus of a sunny backdrop of the snow capped alps, fantastic.

HotelInfo.Name: BEST WESTERN Biasutti
HotelInfo.Address: Via Enrico Dandolo 29 | Lido, 30126 Venice, Italy
